TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricKeyExchangeFormatter

Docs.summary: Creates Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) key exchange data using .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Key exchange allows a sender to create secret information, for example, random data that can be used as a key in a symmetric encryption algorithm, and use encryption to send it to the intended recipient.
Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeDeformatter> to receive the key exchange and extract the secret information from it.
> [!CAUTION] > It is highly recommended that you not attempt to create your own key exchange method from the basic functionality provided, because many details of the operation must be performed carefully in order for the key exchange to be successful.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter> class to create an exchange key for a message recipient.
[!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeDeformatter2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsaoaepkeyexchangedeformatter2/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeDeformatter2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsaoaepkeyexchangedeformatter2/vb/program.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] CreateKeyExchange(unsigned int8[] rgbData) cil managed
Public Overrides Function CreateKeyExchange (rgbData As Byte()) As Byte()

Docs.param: The secret information to be passed in the key exchange.
Docs.summary: Creates the encrypted key exchange data from the specified input data.
Docs.returns: The encrypted key exchange data to be sent to the intended recipient.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This data can be interpreted only by the holder of the private key corresponding to the public key used to encrypt the data. This helps to ensure that only the intended recipient can access the secret information.

MemberSignature.Value: public override byte[] CreateKeyExchange (byte[] rgbData, Type symAlgType);

public: override cli::array <System::Byte> ^ CreateKeyExchange(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ rgbData, Type ^ symAlgType);

Docs.param: The secret information to be passed in the key exchange.
This parameter is not used in the current version.
Docs.summary: Creates the encrypted key exchange data from the specified input data.
Docs.returns: The encrypted key exchange data to be sent to the intended recipient.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This data can be interpreted only by the holder of the private key corresponding to the public key used to encrypt the data. This helps to ensure that only the intended recipient can access the secret information.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter.CreateKeyExchange%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to create an exchange key for a message recipient. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter> class

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the random number generator algorithm to use in the creation of the key exchange.
Docs.value: The instance of a random number generator algorithm to use.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is `null`, the default random number generator algorithm is used.

Docs.summary: Sets the public key to use for encrypting the key exchange data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must set the key before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter.CreateKeyExchange%2A>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAOAEPKeyExchangeFormatter.SetKey%2A> method to set an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> key for decryption.
